comments.body:
Yes, I faced a similar issue as well. This is what happened:

Placed stairs block > replaced stairs block with water source block > Ctrl+Z > stairs block reappears with water source block still in it (essentially creating a waterlogged stairs block) > selected waterlogged stairs block > Ctrl+C > paste > stairs block pasted but with no water source block in it.

If this issue is fixed, a proper way to create waterlogged blocks should also be developed (if it has not been already).

At the very least an instant teleport and/or disable rotation change. Teleporting makes me feel sick and I'm sure I'm not the only one. Because of this I believe this is an accessibility change to editor.

If this means to say that items like balloons and glow sticks should be in the creative inventory, I disagree. The fact that crafting them is the only way to get chemistry objects means that users must actually go through the steps to creating them. No learning would happen if students just took these items from creative mode.

RealCC419 it would actually be better and some learning is better than none. Plus stuff will be more fun for user even if they don't learn. Its a great idea and i think it should be added cause having it only in bedrock edition and pocket edition is kinda unfair to us PC users and other versions who don't have it. I would love to see this in the game.
I agree!  I like using these features, but it's far too much of a pain to actually craft these.
Yes we need the items in creative mode an survival

I Think they should be in creative menu for those who like to build . And it would take so much time to crate every item you would like to use for your creation making it a lot harder for creators to build
Es cierto, de donde los jovenes van a aprnder, no por eso s el tiutlo Minecraft:Education Edition. Por eso no estoy de acuerdo que los items no esten en modo creativo.

I do agree there should be some inclusion of the chemistry workbenches into survival, with the separator there's a survival friendly way to obtain most of the required elements for the current possible recipes, other than helium off the top of my head. It gives an extra usage for left over 'junk' blocks of dirt and cobblestone, and would incentivize players to test all the different block types to see what they would provide. The element constructor could be operated with special materials or possibly be powered by XP, for the elements that are harder to come by. My suggestion would be to make the workbenches midgame content, something around early Nether, with your options of what you can do opening up from there.

I might suggest nerfing the amount of some elements you get from things like dirt, because oxygen builds up very very quickly and I find myself dumping stacks of it into the garbage chute to get it out of the way. But I think that introduction opens up some interesting advanced content that would appeal to players who like the more technical aspects, and would give more room for modders to expand and take advantage of having literally the entire elemental table at hand.

How about we make a new tab of items related to a specific study in the creative menu? (although some items related to chemistry I would love to see as actual items in game someday. Underwater TNT sounds like too much fun)

Adding items such as Ballons and Glowsticks into the creative inventory would be beneficial as you can simply deconstruct them into their elements with the chemistry equipment. However, adding education items to Survival is dangerous as you can make a whole bunch of items without collecting and crafting, by just simply using the element constructor. And for that, I simply do not approve.
what about making diamonds hard to craft? the chance of making a diamond should be very low, say about 3.25% for every diamond. a good percentage of chance?
You mean like, normal minecraft? I guess they could be easy tools to add for map makers? (Tnt that gose off under water could be useful in some map settings)
Freaking large signs. Boundary blockers. Those tools educators need for "server management" in Vanilla because... HELLO! server management in Vanilla without Spigot plugins?
Maybe in creative but not survival
I personally think that it would be pointless to have some things from education edition in survival, like the element blocks.

At first, this does seem like a good idea. But this would end up becoming REALLY complicated for other users who come back from Minecraft so not everything should be accessible in Survival. 2nd There's a reason why it's only available for Minecraft: Education Edition, to be EDUCATIONAL. I'm not saying that people aren't wizards but not everyone is going to be willing to make these items because they can be a real hassle to use. However, there are some items I believe would be awesome to add to the game & won't be tedious for the player.

For example, horses have a kind of genetic evolution when you breed them, as sometimes two good, fast, high jumping horses can create another horse with similar, and mutated effects, sometimes better, sometimes worse, like real genetic evolution. I agree, but the switch should be in the cheats section when you first create a new world. In Bedrock, when you create a world, in the Cheats section (locked by default) you see a switch labelled ‚ÄòEducation Edition‚Äô. If you toggle it, a warning comes up. You press confirm and Education Edition features are on!

If the world creation screen looks different in Java (I‚Äôm not sure where your cheats are), then just put a switch next to the other cheats in the world creation screen.

Not to be mean or hating on java, but I think education edition features should be in bedrock and edu only. Bedrock edition is underrated enough already and basically only console and mobile players play that due to a lot of people hating it. Basically, I'm saying that bedrock edition exclusive features should just be bedrock exclusives for now because java has a lot of exclusive features already like quasi-connectivity, so the editions are more balanced.

Hi there, This feedback is incomplete and not really useable by our team in its current form. Can you explain what you're looking for? Thanks, it will help us express your idea to the team in an actionable way.

What they're trying to say is basically put something between Immersive Engineering and IndustrialCraft (2) into Vanilla They want things like wires, electricity, computers, refrigerators, air conditioning, batteries, genetic engineering, nuclear reactors, particle accelerators, etc. While this all seems really cool, it doesn't really fit with Vanilla.
Have you heard of redstone? That's realistic enough

Redstone is already electricity, but however I do agree that electricity in all editions should be more realistic. I'm thinking of suggesting a circuit builder, like the element constructor, and that there would be one entity for each logic gate and electric components like an AND gate AC or DC adaptor or capacitors, inductors, transistors, etc.. Repeaters should be renamed "diode" for accuracy. You can make all logic gates in all editions of Minecraft, but they take up a lot of space. Also, there should be AC redstone current while redstone should be able to go up straight walls since redstone is only DC and to ascend levels with redstone the blocks below the redstone have to be arranged like a staircase. There should also be methods of discharging the circuit like hitting the circuit with an iron sword or by just dying in the game (if the game is on survival for the students). There are more ideas that could spawn from here.

Podr√≠an poner un objeto que se adhiera
 a los bloques simulando cables y 
que eso sustitulla la redstone que no se puede construir
make restone look like wires Done!!!

Add electric benches (e.g. electric furnaces, electric smokers and electric blast furnaces which are faster than their non-electric versions and new benches like electric sluice which allows you to find ores in gravel). These benches won't use Redstone, but instead, it will use copper wire crafted using the upcoming copper ore and use solar panels, steam generators or wind turbines to generate electricity and flywheels to store electricity.
Redstone is a medium for electricity. Electricity exists in Minecraft already as seen by lightning. Redstone is merely used to transfer electricity

This might need another tab depending, but would help. Or again, in creative having recipe book listings already enabled.

I really enjoy the Chemistry update but very disapointed I cant use them in a normal survival world. I have to sacrifice acheivment getting to play with these new items. Adding the recipes for the 4 tables and also a separate tab in the recipe book for all the craftable items and their componants. A chemistry logbook for your discoveries that only unlocks as you progress through your science expiraments, guiding players toward goals. When the Nether update releases it would be really neat to include these new items to the chemistry lab. A geology update couls alos satisfy the "cave update" community and add to the scientific realism the Chemistry Edition brought to the game. I would love to play more in the lab, but Im a survival player and care little for creative mode other than as a testing ground for new ideas or build styles. I also feel like we need more lab equipment; hot plates with magnetic stir bars, distillation supplies, alchohol burners and lamps, burettes, vacume chambers, PH measuring tool, borosylicate glass, soda-lime glass, safety glass, laminated glass, optical glass, photo-chromatic glass, lead crystal glass, and lastly colored glass dyed with the apropriate metallic oxides.

How about actually making textures for each element? Instead of using a tile for each block.

For say silver, why cant we have a Block of Silver. Or with Mercury, a bucket of Mercury? 

This truly would liven up this whole thing for me. It would get more people interested in it too, as they come to understand that each element is a real thing, not just a tile.

The chemistry blocks should be available in survival mode without having to enable cheats. I suggest that the chemistry blocks, except for the element constructor, should be found in dungeons or it's a reward after defeating the Ender Dragon. All of the elements should be obtained by using the material reducer including the rare ones; for example, a bucket of water could reduce to just 2 Hydrogens and an Oxygen, but there would be like a few chances where Sodium would pop up in the material reducer, or like Tungsten randomly pops up in an Iron or Gold Ore, or random Calcium from Sand, etc. Plus, the ingots should also be able to break down in the reducer.

Please note the word "new' is extraneous and actually makes things harder to discover, and our team only makes changes to make topics easier to discover while searching. (Most, if not all the topics on the feedback site are "new".)

We want to help everyone have their ideas succeed. Thanks for your contribution.
